title: How to use `rvolleydata`
text: vignette outline use functions rvolleydata package access data League One Volleyball Pro (LOVB), Athletes Unlimited Pro Volleyball (AUPVB), Major League Volleyball (MLV) leagues.
code: library(rvolleydata) library(dplyr)

title: How to use `rvolleydata`
text: can install development version rvolleydata GitHub :
code: # install.packages("devtools") devtools::install_github("awosoga/rvolleydata")

title: How to use `rvolleydata`
text: following code snippets provide information access different volleyball league statistics. structure functions similar across League One Volleyball Pro (LOVB) Major League Volleyball (MLV), LOVB functions used example.

title: How to use `rvolleydata`
text: Use load_lovb_schedule access League One Volleyball Pro (LOVB) schedules.
code: load_lovb_schedule <- load_lovb_schedule(2025) glimpse(load_lovb_schedule) #> Rows: 141 #> Columns: 8 #> $ match_id       <dbl> 2161068, 2161068, 2161068, 2161068, 2161068, 2161068, 2… #> $ season         <dbl> 2025, 2025, 2025, 2025, 2025, 2025, 2025, 2025, 2025, 2… #> $ match_datetime <dttm> 2025-01-09 00:30:00, 2025-01-09 00:30:00, 2025-01-09 0… #> $ officials_type <chr> "supervisor", "referee1", "referee2", "refereeChallenge… #> $ full_name      <chr> "MICHELLE PRATER", "PATI ROFF", "SAMARA SEVOR", "MARK P… #> $ first_name     <chr> "MICHELLE", "PATI", "SAMARA", "MARK", "APRIL", "ALAINA"… #> $ last_name      <chr> "PRATER", "ROFF", "SEVOR", "PRATER", "MIFFLIN", "SMITH … #> $ level          <chr> "AAA", "AAA", "AAA", "AAA", "AAA", "AAA", "AAA", "AAA",…
